tool_description: Creates and configures virtual machine instances with specified operating system, resources, and network settings.

provider.description: Cloud provider: aws, azure, gcp, digitalocean

instance_name.description: Unique name for the VM instance

os_image.description: Operating system image: ubuntu-20.04, ubuntu-22.04, centos-7, centos-8, debian-11, windows-server-2019

ssh_key_name.description: SSH key pair name for secure access

user_data_script.description: Initialization script to run on boot

error_messages: Invalid provider: Use one of [aws, azure, gcp, digitalocean].
Authentication failed: Verify access_token is valid and not expired.
Unsupported OS image: Use one of [ubuntu-20.04, ubuntu-22.04, centos-7, centos-8, debian-11, windows-server-2019].
Invalid instance size: Check provider documentation for valid instance types.
Resource limit exceeded: Account has reached maximum instance limit.
Network configuration error: Verify subnet_id and security_groups exist.
SSH key not found: Specified ssh_key_name does not exist in the account.
usage: Provide provider credentials, instance specifications, and optional network/security settings. The tool creates a VM and returns connection details.

instance_id.description: Unique identifier for the created instance

public_ip.description: Public IP address of the instance

private_ip.description: Private IP address of the instance

ssh_connection_string.description: SSH command to connect to the instance
